reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As hotels go, Best Western Cervantes is good value for money, clean and inoffensive. Being in Seville you'll find you dont spend much time in the hotel, as there is so much to see!
reviews.title: No parking!!!!

reviews.text: Two words of warning if travelling by car, the website advertises parking. this mysterious parking is in an underground car park directly under the hotel. But you cannot book this in advance, so if all car parking spaces are taken, you'll have to park in a car park in the city, there is one about a 15 min walk away so you should phone the hotel before you drive into Seville to check availability.
reviews.title: Great Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove to the hotel(eventually after a maze of one way tiny streets) to be told (by a very rude member of staff) to go to a different (more expensive) car park, involving another 20 min drive through the one way system.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — Smallish rooms and a bit noisy at night

reviews.text: Another word of warning is you may find 'helpful' locals directing you to parking spaces in exchange for a few Euros - if you have a car you should park in a secure place.
reviews.title: First impressions were NOT good...

likes.disliked: — The snotty receptionist Diego, and his all round bad atttude would make me not want to go back there.

reviews.text: So apart from staff who are not too polite if you have a problem this is good value hotel for those who are not driving.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place

reviews.text: It is was very, very difficult to reach this hotel by car. The streets around the hotel are extremely narrow and many are one-way. To add to the difficulty, many of the streets in the vicinity were closed during our stay due to road works. The hotel is clean and nicely decorated. Our room and bathroom were very spacious. The room was very quite but the main window was boared up so the light in the room was limited. The breakfast room was too small. Even in December, latecomers had to wait for a table. Okay choice for breakfast. It would have been nice to have had real orange juice (in the land of oranges) and whole grain breakfast cereals. While not over friendly, hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The location is very good for reaching the main sites, Cathedral, etc.
reviews.title: Hotel was good but very inaccessible by car

reviews.text: Like others - I recommend taking a taxi to and from the airport - as the hotel is difficult to locate if you don't know your way around (taxi drivers all knew where it was). The hotel staff were very efficient - helpful in phoning for taxies and answering questions. We didn't opt for the break fast, but walked to nearby pastry shops. Our room was on the street side, but very quiet. Beware of a visit in winter - as we were informed the hotel does not heat the rooms - but the A/C is excellent!
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 day visit to Seville, and found the Cervantes to be exactly what we needed. We were on a "lads weekend away" and one of us had booked flights (0.99p outward!) and hotel reservation online.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

likes.liked: — Price, and close enough to central areas

reviews.text: The hotel sits in a labrynth of narrow streets, but our taxi driver found it without a problem. Taxi from airport was 35E, but strangely only 25 Euros on our return - using a taxi picked up in town.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

reviews.text: Finding the place by hire car could be tricky, and there aren't any obvious parking places around. However, that's the nature of central Seville.
reviews.title: Deluge!

likes.liked: — Groundfloor accommodation windows looking into pleasange inner courtyard
likes.disliked: — Bathroom flooding every time we showered.

reviews.text: Hotel Cervantes is nearly impossible to find. It is on a small one way street and the signs to the hotel do not lead you there by car. The hotel was extremely noisy and the beds not particularly comfortable. The hotel has no charm and I can not think of one reason to recommend it.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.text: Recently returned from unexpectedly hot stay at this well sited hotel . Conveniently placed for main sights but in quiet back street.Attractive hotel with internal courtyards but room we had was with only 1 small window on ground floor looking towards courtyard but without much natural light . Not a major problem as not much time spent in it . Bathrooms are well fitted with better than average quality fitments.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We breakfasted at La Campana 5 minutes walk away which was good value and an historic patisserie/cafe.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.text: Would stay again but would possibly try to get better located room .
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're just back after a 4 night stay in the Hotel Cervantes. I booked this hotel ages ago through the hotel website and requested a room in the ViP section of the hotel on the advise of previous reviewers. Room 262 was perfect: roomy, kingsize bed, air con, a balcony in the bedroom and one in the very spacious bathroom. My rate included breakfast which was great: fresh o.j., fresh fruit, yoghurts, breads, cheese, cold meats and a coffee machine. The location is perfect: the walk to the Cathedral is about 10mins, maybe 15mins max - no problem. One day we walked to the Santa Justa train station which only took about 15mins too - we took a train to Cordoba which is just a 35min journey - well worth a visit too. All sites are within walking distance - just wear your (flat) sandals and stroll about and enjoy the sites. One more thing: don't bother packing dressy clothes - it's a very casual city. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. They stored our bags after check-out and ordered a taxi to the airport.
reviews.title: Good location
Very good hotel for price and a FANTASTIC location!
reviews.text: My fiancée and I spent four nights in the Best Western Cervantes Hotel during late February ’07. We both agreed that it represented an excellent choice for us in terms of value, comfort and location. I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending it to anybody intending on spending a break in Seville.

reviews.title: A very pleasant experience
reviews.text: From the airport getting to the hotel was absolutely no problem. If you follow Chester’s instructions in a previous review (Jan 27, ’07) you’ll have no bother being in your room within an hour of landing.

reviews.title: First time at the Cervantes, but not last! I'll be back ;-)
reviews.text: All staff members working in the hotel were absolutely professional at all times. Those manning the reception desk were helpful and polite, speaking English, French and Italian with various guests. I found them excellent in all my dealings with them. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, preferring to do our own thing in the mornings, but it's on offer if you want.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: The room itself was big enough for us, a comfortable bed, adequate storage, high ceilings, large windows, and a very well appointed bathroom. During our stay the hotel itself was calm and quiet and there was very little outside noise during the night. Each day the room was cleaned perfectly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was especially happy with the location. Calle Cervantes is a long narrow street very close to the central main shopping area of Seville. Most obvious monuments and attractions are 10-15 minutes by foot and that’s no exaggeration. It’s nestled on the border of the Centro and Almeda areas and that is an excellent place to be based. The streets in Almeda are similar to the barrio Santa Cruz but less touristic. Two minutes from the hotel in a little square is the brilliant local bar Santa Marta. Great stuff!!!
reviews.title: Hotel Cervantes you pays your money and takes your choice
